results.title: Liberte 1 = Liberty 1 (Cinemascope Print)
results.brief_description:
Michel is in charge of building a road cutting through the savanna of Senegal. When the building work threatens a sacred tree, Michel has to face the wrath of the villagers of Tiolene. The film looks at the difficulties faced by an ex-colony once it has received its independence. Corrupt structures do not disappear with the colonialists, but remained ingrained in the practices of the indigenous bourgeois class. This film was the first French-Senegal co-production. See also: ‘Xala’ (Ousmane Sembene, 1974) held in our collection.

Credits: Producer, Jean Cotet ; director, Yves Ciampi ; witers,
Cast: Corinne Marchand, Maurice Ronet, Nanette Senghor, Iba Guey

results.title: Remontons les Champs-Elysees = Let's Walk Back Up to the Champs-Elysees
results.creator_credit: Robert Bibal, Guy Lacourt and Serge Sandberg
results.brief_description:
In order to break the routine of his lessons, a school teacher decides to tell his pupils the story of the Champs-Elysees, from the Renaissance to Napoleon III. This light historical comedy is a pretext for Guitry to play five roles and to play games with historical facts and famous characters.

Credits: Producers, Guy Lacourt, Serge Sandberg ; directors, Robert Bibal, Sacha Guitry ; writer, Sacha Guitry ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Adolphe Borchard ; stills photographer, Raymond Voinquel.
Cast: Sacha Guitry, Jean Davy, Jacqueline Delubac, Jane Marken, Mila Parely, Jeanne Boitel, Lucien Baroux.

results.title: Une Aussi Longue Absence = the Long Absence
results.creator_credit: Henri Colpi, Claude Jaeger and Jacques Nahum
results.brief_description:
In this touching tearjerker, a lonesome owner of a Parisian caf√© spies on a passing tramp. He hums a strangely familiar tune and the woman is convinced that he is her estranged husband who was deported 16 years before. She follows the wanderer back to his miserable shanty beside the Seine, where she learns that he has been an amnesiac since the war. She takes him back to her cafe in the hope that it will jog his failed memory and sees a terrible scar on the back of his head. In her heart, she realises his memory will never return, but this does not stop her from spending the rest of her days trying to get him to remember something from their happy past. With ‘Une aussi longue absence’ Colpi has used his cinematic knowledge to serve a sensitivity, a quality of emotion, a delightful purity and a humanity very rarely seen on the screen nowadays. With images of a great beauty (by Marcel Weiss), the film delivers a remarkable sketch of a suburban community”. Reference: Le Film Francais, 16 June 1961. Awards: Prix Louis-Delluc 1960 ; Palme d’Or Cannes Film Festival 1961.

Credits: Producers, Jacques Nahum, Claude Jaeger; director, Henri Colpi ; writers, Marguerite Duras, Gerard Jarlot, Henri Colpi ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Alida Valli, Georges Wilson, Amedee, Charles Blavette, Nane Germon.

results.title: Poulet Au Vinaigre = Cop Au Vin
results.brief_description:
A quiet little town, like so many others … Doctor Philippe Morasseau, attorney Hubert Lavoisier and butcher Gerard Filiol are partners in a building project. But first, they must evict the widow Cuno and her son, the village postman. Things take a nasty turn when the doctor’s wife disappears and the butcher dies in a car accident. Enters Inspector Lavardin, a hard-nosed cop with unconventional methods. The film was a great box-office success and was followed by a sequel, ‘Inspecteur Lavardin’ in 1985.

Credits: Producer, Marin Karmitz ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writers, Claude Chabrol, Dominique Roulet ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Matthieu Chabrol.
Cast: Jean Poiret, Michel Bouquet, Lucas Belvaux, Jean-Claude Bouillaud, Caroline Cellier, Josephine Chaplin, Pauline Lafont, Stephane Audran, Andree Tainsy, Jean Topart.

results.title: Vivre Sa Vie = My Life to Live
results.brief_description:
Unable to pay her rent, Nana, a girl from the provinces, is gradually initiated into prostitution in Paris. Using interview techniques, direct sound, long takes, texts, quotation and statistics, Godard gives this probing and dazzling examination of prostitution (in 12 chapters) a documentary tone. The film is dedicated to B movies. Awards: Venice Film Festival (1962): Special jury prize.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Jean-Luc Godard ; photography, Raoul Coutard ; music, Michel Legrand.
Cast: Anna Karina, Saddy Rebbot, Andre Labarthe, Peter Kassowitz.

results.title: Bebert et L'omnibus = Bebert and the Bus
results.brief_description:
Bebert is a five-year-old boy who becomes separated from his older brother on a train. The precocious moppet observes the less-than-grown-up activities of the adults as he seeks to be reunited with his family.

Credits: Producer, Leon Carre ; director, Yves Robert ; writer, Francois Boyer ; photography, Andre Bac ; Music, Philippe Gerard ; musical direction, Francois Rauber ; editor, Andre and Monique Isnardon.
Cast: Petit Gibus, Blanchette Brunoy, Pierre Mondy, Jean Richard, Michel Serrault, Jacques Higelin, Jean Lefebvre, Tsilla Chelton, Sophie Grimaldi.

results.title: Volpone
results.brief_description:
After one of his ships fails to return safely to Venice, Volpone, a wealthy merchant finds himself crippled with debts and sent to prison. When the ship finally appears, Volpone is released, vying for revenge. With the help of Mosca, a former cellmate, Volpone fakes his own death and bequests his fortune to Mosca. At first, Volpone enjoys the spectacle of his greedy creditors fighting for the spoils. But then the joke turns sour as Mosca proceeds to evict Volpone from his own palace.

Credits: Producer, A. Hertz ; director, Maurice Tourneur ; writer, Jules Romains ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Marcel Delannoy.
Cast: Harry Baur, Louis Jouvet, Charles Dullin, Jacqueline Delubac, Alexandre Rignault, Fernand Ledoux, Pierre Sabbagh.

results.title: Garde a Vue = the Grilling
results.creator_credit: Claude Miller, Alexandre Mnouchkine, George Dancigers, Films Ariane and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description:
On New Year’s Eve, Inspector Antoine Gallien, assisted by Belmont are questioning local attorney Martinaud in regard to the rape and murder of two young girls whose bodies have been found on the beach. Martinaud knew one of the children. At first the questioning progresses politely, and then less so, as the interrogation team chips away at the suspect’s alibi and Martinaud becomes the prime suspect. Claude Miller’s film appears as a discreet homage to H.G. Clouzot’s ‘Quai des Orfevres’. Both films share the New Year’s Eve setting and the same names for the police inspectors. Awards: Prix Melies 1981 ; Grand Prix du Cinema Francais 1981 ; Montreal Film Festival - Best Scenario.

Credits: Producers, Alexandre Mnouchkine, Georges Dancigers ; director, Claude Miller ; writers, Michel Audiard, Jean Herman, Claude Miller ; photography, Bruno Nuytten ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Lino Ventura, Michel Serrault, Romy Schneider, Guy Marchand, Elsa Lunghini, Jean-Claude Penchenat, Pierre Maguelon, Mathieu Schiffman, Michel Such, Patrick Depeyrat.

results.title: La Beaute du Diable = Beauty and the Devil
results.brief_description:
Rene Clair became fascinated with a structural defect in the ‘Faust’ legend, wondering what would happen if, instead of forcing Faust to sign his soul away in exchange for happiness and knowledge, the Devil were to ask for nothing, and simply assume that Faust would sign the contract at a later date. Since Hiroshima, the nuclear threat was a constant source of concern, and Clair’s film was released in a Cold War climate in which Faust regains his soul only after rejecting the thought of owning limitless powers.

Credits: Producers, Salvo d’Angelo, Rene Clair ; director, Rene Clair ; writers, Rene Clair, Armand Salacrou ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Roman Vlad ; assistant director, Michel Boisrond ; costumes, Mayo.
Cast: Michel Simon, Gerard Philipe, Simone Valere, Nicole Besnard, Carlo Ninchi, Paolo Stoppa, Raymond Cordy, Gaston Modot.

results.title: Quatorze Juillet = Fourteenth of July
results.brief_description:
On Bastille Day in Paris, a flower-girl and her taxi driver boyfriend meet various people. A child is born, a woman dies, there is a hold-up, and a drunkard is blissfully unaware of his surroundings. Clair’s films have the same reputation for gaiety as Paris, the city he loved. This light comedy is the last of Clair’s pre-war ‘Paris’ pictures. The city is more the creation of Russian emigre set designer Lazare Meerson who created the ideal space for Clair’s choreographed characters.

Credits: Director, Rene Clair ; writer, Rene Clair ; photography, Georges Perinal ; music, Maurice Jaubert ; art direction, Lazare Meerson.
Cast: Annabella, Georges Rigaud, Pola Illery, Thomy Bourdelle, Aimos, Raymond Cordy.
